alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 3:09AM MST until March 01 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Dry and windy conditions will return on Wednesday afternoon across the east-central plains and middle Rio Grande Valley, allowing critical fire weather conditions to return for several hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) from 11 AM this morning through 6 PM MST this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...14 to 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
